result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbie Jo Lentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct in a Private Place [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons including but not limited to knives.

Defendant to comply with any terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant to complete Anger Managment Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: JOC returned by USPS - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward

ADDRESS INFO for Bobbie Jo Lentz
Current: N3268 State Road ZZ, Wautoma, WI 54982-5336 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2014)
Prior: 510 Fairview Court, Wautoma, WI 54982

Case called @ 11:08 a.m. Defendant Bobbie Jo Lentz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Upon motion of the State the Court amends Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct in a Private Place with a Domestic Abuse provision. Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S -18 mos probation - Anger Managment, Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons including but not limited to knives, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, costs to include DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2014 at 11:00 am.
